items.text: One or more resource groups is required for onboarding servers into Azure
items.description: Define a resource group structure for placement of Azure Arc-enabled servers resources

items.text: Take Azure Active Directory object limitations into account
Has the Resource providers required been registered in all subscriptions
items.description: The following resource providers needs to be registered: Microsoft.HybridCompute, Microsoft.GuestConfiguration, Microsoft.HybridConnectivity

items.text: Has a tagging strategy for Azure Arc-enabled servers been defined
items.description: Aligning with an existing or creating an Azure tagging strategy is recommended. Resource tags allow you to quickly locate it, automate operational tasks amd more.

items.text: What operating systems need to be Azure Arc-enabled
items.description: Installation of the connected machine agent is supported on most newer Windows and Linux operative systems, review the link to se the latest list

items.text: Are required software installed on Windows and Linux servers to support the installation
items.description: There are software requirements to the agent installation. Some might require a system reboot after installation, review to link

items.text: Make sure to use a supported Azure region
Define the structure for Azure management of resources
items.description: The scope include organization into management groups, subscriptions, and resource groups.

items.text: Assign RBAC rights to Azure AD user/group access for managing Azure Arc-enabled servers
items.description: Define RBAC rules to the servers / resource groups as required for servers management, the 'Azure Connected Machine Resource Administrator' or 'Hybrid Server Resource Administrator' role would be sufficient for management of the Azure Arc-enabled servers resources in Azure

items.text: Consider using managed identities for applications to access Azure resources like Key Vault example in link
An Azure Active Directory tenant must be available with at least one subscription
items.description: An Azure subscription must be parented to the same Azure AD tenant

items.text: Define which users (AAD user/groups) has access to onboard Azure Arc-enabled servers
items.description: Users (or SPs) need the 'Azure Connected Machine Onboarding' or 'Contributor' role to onboarding of servers

items.text: Use the principle of least privileged
items.description: Ensure to only add the rights to users or groups that is required to perform their role

items.text: How many Service Principals are needed for onboarding Arc-enabled servers into Azure
items.description: A service principle with the 'Azure Connected Machine Onboarding' role is required for at-scale onboarding of servers, consider more SP's if onboarding is done by different teams/decentralized management

items.text: Limit the rights to onboard Azure Arc-enabled servers to the desired resource groups
items.description: Consider assigning the rights for the 'Azure Connected Machine Onboarding' role at the resource group level, to control the resource creation

items.text: Define a strategy for agent provisioning
items.description: Plan for agent deployments at scale

items.text: Define a strategy for agent updates
items.description: Use Microsoft Update to ensure that the connected machine agent is always up-to-date

items.text: Define a strategy for extension installation
items.description: Recommendation is to use Azure Policy, or another automation tool like Azure DevOps - important is to avoid configuration drift.

items.text: Define a strategy for extension updates
items.description: Use automatic upgrades where available and define an update strategy for all extensions not supporting automatic upgrades.
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines/extensions'| extend compliant = (properties.enableAutomaticUpgrade == 'true') | distinct id, compliant

items.text: Consider using Azure Machine Configuration to control settings and avoid configuration drift on servers
items.description: Azure Machine Configuration to help implement Microsoft best-practices for servers management in Azure

items.text: Monitor for unresponsive agents
Design a monitoring strategy to send metrics and logs to an Log Analytics workspace
Use notification in Activity logs to receive notification on unexpected changes to the resources
Use Azure Monitor for compliance and operational monitoring
Create an alert to identify Azure Arc-enabled servers that aren't using the latest version of the Azure connected machine agent
Use Azure Arc-enabled servers to control software updates deployments to servers
items.description: Use Azure Update Manager to manage and schedule updates at scale across your Azure Arc-enabled servers
items.graph: resources | where type =~ 'microsoft.hybridcompute/machines' | project id = tolower(id), arcMachineName = name | join kind=leftouter (maintenanceresources | extend baseIdParts = split(tolower(id), '/providers/microsoft.maintenance/') | extend maintenanceMachineId = tostring(baseIdParts[0]) | project maintenanceMachineId, maintenanceId = id) on $left.id == $right.maintenanceMachineId | extend compliant = iif(maintenanceMachineId == '', 'No', 'Yes') | project id, compliant

items.text: Define a connectivity method from the server to Azure
items.description: The Connected Machine Agent will by default communicate with Azure services over public Internet connectivity using HTTPS (TCP port 443)

items.text: Is a proxy server a required for communication over the Public Internet
items.description: The Connected Machine Agent can be configured to use a proxy server, it is recommended to define the proxy server address using 'azcmagent config set proxy.url' command on the local system.

items.text: Is a private (not public Internet) connection required?
items.description: The Connected Machine Agent can use a Private Link for communication with Azure Services over an existing ExpressRoute or VPN connection

items.text: Will Firewall configurations be needed in order to ensure communication with Azure Services?
items.description: Firewall configuration might be required for the agent to communicate with Azure, use the link to see ServiceTags and/or URL's required

items.text: Can the Firewall or Proxy rules be automated updated if Service Tags or IP addresses change
items.description: Use available automation tool for the system in question to regularly update the Azure endpoints

items.text: Always use secure communication for Azure where possible
items.description: Configure Servers to use Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1.2

items.text: Include communication for Azure Arc-enabled Servers extensions in the design (firewall/proxy/private link)
items.description: All extensions (like log analytics etc.) have separate network requirements, be sure to include all in the network design.

items.text: Use Azure Policy to implement a governance model for hybrid connected servers
Consider using Machine configurations for in guest OS configurations
Evaluate the need for custom Guest Configuration policies
Consider using change tracking for tracking changes made on the servers
Make sure to use an Azure region for storing the metadata approved by the organization
Use Azure Key Vault for certificate management on servers
What is the acceptable life time of the secret used by SP's
items.description: Consider using a short-lived Azure AD service principal client secrets.

items.text: Secure the public key for Azure Arc-enabled Servers
items.description: A private key is saved to the disk, ensure this is protected using disk encryption

items.text: Ensure there is local administrator access for executing the agent installation
items.description: Local administrator is required to install the Connected Machine Agent on Windows and Linux systems

items.text: Limit the amount of users with local administrator rights to the servers
items.description: Members of the local administrator group on Windows and users with root privileges on Linux, have permissions to manage the agent via command line.

items.text: Consider using and restricting access to managed identities for applications.
Enable Defender for Servers for all servers to secure hybrid workloads from threats
items.description: Use Defender for Endpoint or another AV and EDR solution to protect endpoints

items.text: Define controls to detect security misconfigurations and track compliance
Use allow- or block-lists to control what extensions can be installed on the Azure Arc-enabled servers
